bow: baby does babble my daughter is eight months old physically her development is right on track it always has been she rolls over sits unassisted for as long as she wants can sit herself up from lying down pulls to standing waves claps and is working on crawling but she does babble no baba no gaga no dada no mama she knows her name knows the dog name and clearly understands words like milk bath eat and few others so she definitely all there friend with daughter one month younger than mine has posted videos of her baby saying dada and mama it breaks my heart is something wrong with my kiddo she says hey we re still not sure if she actually saying word or just making baby noises and will occasionally say things that sound like made up words like hestaguh or hecked or loosecheck but no ms ds ps etc obviously ll bring this up at her next doctor appointment but it not for another month and get so upset every time see video of my friend younger baby saying actual words how can best help my kiddo sounds like your kid is developing fine there huge developmental time frame for these things my 11 months old barely says mama or dada it usually just like you said made up words that normal that her developing what it like to speak do be concerned but do talk to her pediatrician to ease your mind some babies develop faster than others it does mean they re special and it does mean your child is behind thanks do or did before had baby know those things but it so hard to remember when looking at my little one and wanting her to be as she should be thank you for saying it it helps to hear seven or eight months is pretty young to be saying words wouldn be worried at all babies develop at their own pace and comparing your baby to others will only stress you out does she mirror facial expressions does she laugh lack of babbling laughing mirroring expressions can indicate autism in infants would talk to your pediatrician fwiw my daughter started babbling at exactly months went from just random sounds to babababa and mamamamama within few days it understandable it hard to think clearly when you see other children developing quicker but still normally do worry though it fine about to graduate with degree in early childhood development if that any consolation ❤️ your friend kid might say mama or dada but it unlikely that the kid actually knows what the words mean exactly they re just early sounds as they re considered easy to make my kid formed mama mama mama at months but it was long while before she connected it to mean me long time she now and chatty af if that any consolation but yeah your pediatrician will have better idea of whether or not anything is wrong if you live in the us you can get free developmental evaluation for children birth to each state administers it differently but it an entitlement program through the ada you can make referral or your pediatrician can if that easier do it for living but the language portion is not my area administer the social emotional and self help eating sleeping etc portions my partner is an expert in the other areas an month old is not expected to be saying words with meaning but there are consonant sounds that we are looking for it hard to say whether child is delayed unless you see them in person though she laughs and is very social loves people and interacting with them not quite sure she mirrors facial expressions but the other day two of my best friends were playing with her by drumming on the table and she watched them for minute and then joined right in drumming with them not the same as facial expressions know but she does observe the world around her and participate another thing she does is make sure people are watching when does something she proud of we video chat with my mother almost daily she she loves to show her grammie how she can pull herself to standing and then she ll immediately turn and look at the phone to make sure her grammie saw her do it she does the same thing with her daddy when he home not sure if any of that is relevant or not my daughter didnt speak until she was 20 months old no mama dada she would say ba for everything currently going to school for speech therapy and felt like an absolute failure was doing everything thought was supposed to like reading books narrating daily activities and still she just would speak asked the pediatrician about speech therapy and they referred her but before could take her for an evaluation her vocabulary exploded she went from word to over 150 in about months shes 25 months old now and is speaking in complete sentences obviously follow your pediatricians advice but remember that every child develops at their own pace if your child is understanding things being said to them would worry too much good luck my son was the same way except he made zero noises until he was about months old not single ah or uh nothing came out of his mouth was starting to get really worried then one day he just started babbling babies are all so different and develop at their own paces its hard not to worry about this kind of stuff but im sure she ll start soon my first son he almost years old now was the same way right on track other than babbling honestly he was late talker though we never did speech therapy because it wasn problem for us but all kids are different when he did decide to speak and truly believe it was decision on his part it was in full sentences at around years old now he is intelligent and has great vocabulary my second kid is months and babbles all the time she sounds fine most babies don really babble at that age and they certainly don talk my son didn say his first word until well after his first birthday and now he and won stop talking that is the cutest thing ve ever heard my lo is only months right now but you just made me really look forward to that echo what the others have said does seem like you have anything to worry about since shes developmentally where she should be my kid is months old and still wo wave let alone clap she babbles but no momma or da da yet there is no perfect timetable my little cousin was almost completely nonverbal until he was around or even later he was very expressive but just no words turned out little diaperbutt was just extremely lazy since he was surrounded by adults who were always trying to understand his motions and faced and offered anything he might want he just had no need to talk it changed in daycare kindergarten don know whats the us equivalent anyway it changed when he was around other kids more because they just ignored what he wanted if he didn say so hasn stopped talking for second since my daughter didn say anything until 18 months and now she and way ahead of her peers verbally would not worry one bit unless your pediatrician is concerned was so worried about my son not saying words at that age either he is now 16 months and says lot and has babble conversations all the time it hard to not get in your own head about where your baby is developmentally keep on keeping on momma and know your child is doing just fine the fact that she making any noise and isn resistant to making peaceful noises means she isn nonverbal so you have nothing to worry about it will come in its own time first off don worry second check with your pediatrician next time you see them they will likely tell you it probably too early to worry if you had normal pregnancy and no major trauma or illness during infancy third look your child in the eye when you mimic words straight face to face but in fun way babel to your lo and mock simple words just keep that up as practice they should be old enough to engage in that for few minutes now even if they don need help it good bonding experience fourth if your kid does need speech therapy it not the end of the world felt like had failed my son when his pediatrician recommended speech therapy getting through that feeling was process but it was my own hang up once we started speech therapy he loooved it it was parent student class with about other kids and he looked forward to it every time we went we ve been going for about year and half now and he right on track but he doesn want to leave because he having so much fun remember that feeling but you know even if your lo does need help you caught it early although from all the speech kids met it really doesn sounds like it an actually problem yet removed often babies can not develop both linguistic skills and physical skills simultaneously my baby goes weeks without babbling and will just try to physical things she months and mastered standing she terrible crawler she says no words but sometimes shouts ya ya ya or ba ba ba ba it fine she will get there eventually development pathologist and that is not an accurate statement many children make noises and are also nonverbal not saying this is the case for the op but wanted to set the record straight children who are nonspeaking later in life due to developmental disabilities like autism are physically capable of making many noises and sounds this as preschool teacher it really bothers me how little birth to three is utilized it doesn sound like concern but if you feel like she needs to work her mouth muscles more try more solid foods solids are great for motor skill development we do baby led weaning so she already working on those muscles good to know it can help she can definitely hear and they screened her hearing at birth but obviously we will take any recommendations her doctor gives us we had 14 month of foster boy who never made noise started early intervention and speech therapy went from words to phrases over night he wasn ready to talk but speech helped him and months later he all caught up any issue with nursing could be possible tongue tie making it difficult for her to speak since she can understand words think it unlikely it development disorder or anything my neighbour kid was like that he almost and just started saying word sentences all of sudden each kid develops differently wouldn worry too much about your lo good idea to talk to your doc though just to ease your mind it does led weaning is great she ll develop as her own pace and birth to three is great if you feel she needs to be evaluated she had tongue and lip tie revised at weeks her doctor is also an ibclc so she did it herself ll ask her if it possible that something still not right there would worry just yet my month old cant even sit up yet let alone clap they all develop at different rates anyway sometimes kids have enough hearing to respond to sounds but some hearing impairment often from recurrent ear infections so that the speech they hear is clear and sounds muffled this can affect their
